result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael L Grigsby

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Michael L Grigsby in court.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court by ADA Vivien TenHaken. Called @3:39 pm. Appearances made. Record by Defendant that he has attained Attorney Mistrioty, who could not be here today and requests another date. Court sets as requested.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Michael L Grigsby in court.  Prosecuting attorney J J. Crawford in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant given complaint; charges/penalties explained by the court. Defendant did retain attorney Mistrioty, Minutes filed.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Michael L Grigsby in court. Vivien TenHaken appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Right to attorney and attorney options form given to defendant. Defendant referred to SPD. State needs more time to make charging decision. Minutes filed.
Hearing scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Signed bond filed with the court.

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant is not to enter any bars, taverns, or liquor stores. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons. Defendant is to be booked and printed within twenty-four (24) hours. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH S.E.L. or RESIDENCE. If defendant and victim(s) are living together, defendant may go to their residence once with a police officer to retrieve the defendant's personal belongings. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant. 
22-4458 thru 22-4461, & 22-4463
